pair.Response:
Prompt: MONTAGUE & CO. v. LOWRY
Response: MONTAGUE & CO. v. LOWRY was a case decided by the Supreme Court of the United States on October Term, 1903. The court held that the plaintiffs had not been asked to join the association at its formation, that they did not fill the condition provided for in its constitution as to eligibility, and that if they had applied their application was subject to arbitrary rejection. The court also held that the purchase and sale of tiles between the manufacturers in one State and dealers therein in California was interstate commerce within the Addyston. Pipe case, 175 U.S. 211. The judgment was affirmed.
